","new_str":"import subprocess
import sys
import random

def run_test(input_s: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'solution.py'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
    out, err = p.communicate(input_s)
    return p.returncode, out, err

# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]

all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:
        print('Expected:')
        print(expected)
        print('Got:')
        print(out)
        print('Err:')
        print(err)
        all_ok = False

# Additional random tests

def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs

for t in range(200):
    N = random.randint(1, 8)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = []
    for _ in range(Q):
        a = random.randint(1, N)
        b = random.randint(1, N)
        if a == b:
            b = (b % N) + 1
        queries.append((a,b))
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    if rc != 0:
        print('Runtime error on random test', rc, err)
        all_ok = False
        break
    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines and out_lines[0] != '' else []
    if out_nums != expected:
        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break

print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')
","security_risk":"LOW"}

extras.new_content:
import subprocess
import sys
import random

def run_test(input_s: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'solution.py'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
    out, err = p.communicate(input_s)
    return p.returncode, out, err

# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]

all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:
        print('Expected:')
        print(expected)
        print('Got:')
        print(out)
        print('Err:')
        print(err)
        all_ok = False

# Additional random tests

def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs

for t in range(200):
    N = random.randint(1, 8)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = []
    for _ in range(Q):
        a = random.randint(1, N)
        b = random.randint(1, N)
        if a == b:
            b = (b % N) + 1
        queries.append((a,b))
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    if rc != 0:
        print('Runtime error on random test', rc, err)
        all_ok = False
        break
    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines and out_lines[0] != '' else []
    if out_nums != expected:
        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break

print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')

+    if not ok:
+        print('Expected:')
+        print(expected)
+        print('Got:')
+        print(out)
+        print('Err:')
+        print(err)
+        all_ok = False
+
+# Additional random tests
+
+def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
+    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
+    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
+        boxes[i].append(c)

+    for a,b in queries:
+        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
+        boxes[a] = []
+        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
+    return outputs
+
+for t in range(200):
+    N = random.randint(1, 8)
+    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
+    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
+    queries = []

+        a = random.randint(1, N)
+        b = random.randint(1, N)
+        if a == b:
+            b = (b % N) + 1
+        queries.append((a,b))
+    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
+    for a,b in queries:
+        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
+    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)

+        print('Runtime error on random test', rc, err)
+        all_ok = False
+        break
+    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
+    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
+    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines and out_lines[0] != '' else []

+        print('Random test failed')

+        print('colors=',colors)
+        print('queries=',queries)
+        print('expected=',expected)
+        print('got=',out_nums)
+        all_ok = False
+        break
+
+print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')
